ngiemboon: Yɔɔn nò tɔ́g, Pɔ̂ɔ fó tÿǒsoŋo Atɛ̀ne ńgʉa lé tÿǒsoŋ Koléŋtò.
en: After this, he   left Athens and went to Corinth,  # 18:1 Ac 17:15; 19:1; 1Co 1:2; 2Co 1:1,23; 2Tm 4:20

ngiemboon: Ńgʉa tà ńkúu wó, ńgyá tsɔ̌ nyìŋ Yúndà gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Akilásè. Mbà mé la zyé yé tsɛ̀ɛ pàga ngwòŋ Pôŋ. Pɔ́ nzwě we Pelésékà nyé tá ńtóo, éfóo ngwòŋ Ítali. Mbà Kásà Kɔlɔnde ka tsẅi ngie pà Yúndà ntsèm, é fó tÿǒsoŋo Loma ńgʉa. Pɔ̂ɔ gʉa ńgúɔ wɔ́b.
en: where he found a Jew named Aquila,   a native of Pontus, who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla because Claudius had ordered all the Jews to leave Rome. Paul came to them,

ngiemboon: Páʼ pâ Pɔ̂ɔ lɔ́ɔn ḿbú faʼa pɔ́ tàʼ ntí fàʼ, á gwɔ́ lélɔg nzsǒ ńnyɛte mentàb la, Pɔ̂ɔ lɔ́ɔn ńcʉ́ʼʉ ńtsẅé pɔ́ mbʉ̀a pɔ́b, pâ pɔ̌ pú faʼa.
en: and since they were of the same occupation, tentmakers by trade,   he stayed with them and worked.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ yɛ̌ lyɛʼɛ́ nzse pà Yúndà wɔ́ɔ, Pɔ̂ɔ gʉa ndá cúʼtè pɔ́b, éfaʼa shÿó léshwóŋ pà Yúndà pâ pà Ngelékiya nò, tà pɔ́ júʼ, ḿbiŋ ńzẅíŋ.
en: He reasoned in the synagogue every Sabbath and tried to persuade both Jews and Greeks.

ngiemboon: Silásè pɔ́ Timotê gÿo ńgwɔ́ tà fó Makendónia ńtó, Pɔ̂ɔ cʉ́ʼ ńnéŋe twó pɔ́ ndàʼ léshwóŋo nò Ssé, ńne ńnyɛte ńkyagte, éshwóŋo pà Yúndà ngie Yěsô zɔɔ Nzàʼnkÿo gẅie pɔ́ tsẅé ḿbyɛ́bɛ.
en: When Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia, Paul devoted himself to preaching the word   and testified to the Jews that Jesus is the Messiah.  # 18:5 Jb 32:18; Ac 15:22; 16:1,9; 17:3,14–15; 18:28; 1Th 3:6

ngiemboon: Táʼ, pà Yúndà tiŋ pɔ́ ndʉ̀ʼ, ńzoonte Pɔ̂ɔ. Á leen ńcʉ́ʼ ḿbúʼ pɔ́ pfepfɔ́b na menzsǒ mé, ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «Pi lɔɔn kúu pyé, mbà á ne ńdíe pɔ́ gẅí, mbà yɔ́ɔn nò té mǒ wɔ́. N ge fó fʉ̀ʼɔɔn, é cʉ́ʼʉ shwóŋo nò Ssé pɔ́ mbwó pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́.»
en: When they resisted and blasphemed,   he shook out his clothes  # 18:6 Neh 5:13; Mt 10:14; Ac 13:51 and told them, “Your blood is on your own heads!  # 18:6 2Sm 1:16; Ezk 18:13; 33:4; Mt 27:25 I am innocent.  # 18:6 Lit clean From now on I will go to the Gentiles.”  # 18:6 Ezk 3:18; Ac 13:46

ngiemboon: Pɔ̂ɔ gɔɔn púʼu, éfó ndá cúʼtè ńkẅɛ, ńgʉa lé mbʉ̀a tsɔ̌ nyìŋ gẅie mé tóŋo yé lê Titẅísè Yutúsè. Á gwɔ́ nyìŋ, mbà à la záb ntʉ́m we na Ssé pà Yúndà. Ndá yé gwóon ńgwɔ́ pɔ́ ngʉ̀ŋe ndá cúʼtè pà Yúndà.
en: So he left there and went to the house of a man named Titius Justus, a worshiper of God, whose house was next door to the synagogue.

ngiemboon: Kelisepúsè gẅie aa ndÿò tsɛ̀ɛ ndá cúʼtè pà Yúndà pâ ngẅɛ̀ ndá ye ntsèm gÿo ńzáb ntʉ́m wɔ́b ná Cʉ̀apʉ̀a. Epʉ̀a Koléŋtò tà ńgyɔ́ɔn júʼu shwóŋè Pɔ̂ɔ, ńzẅíŋ yɔ́b légwɔ́ pʉ̀a Keleto. Mé nuʼu wɔ́b ntse.
en: Crispus, the leader of the synagogue, believed in the Lord, along with his whole household.   Many of the Corinthians, when they heard, believed and were baptized.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ tsɔ̌ letsẅɛ́ʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn né Pɔ̂ɔ ngie: «Pɔ́ɔn lé cÿɔ̀ʼ! Shwóŋo nò yɔ́ɔn shwóŋ, te láŋte,
en: The Lord said to Paul in a night vision, “Don’t be afraid, but keep on speaking and don’t be silent.

ngiemboon: mélàʼmie pɔ̀gɔ zɔ pǔ ńgwɔ́ nùɔ. Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ te kuʼu légwoon gú tà ńgÿo nò tepòŋ na gù wɔ́. N gɔɔn páʼɔɔn, ńtí nue pʉ̀a pɔ́ɔn ée tÿǒsoŋ yɔɔn tà ńgyɔ́ɔn.»
en: For I am with you, and no one will lay a hand on you to hurt you, because I have many people in this city.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ̂ɔ tsẅé Koléŋtò tàʼ ngùʼ lê mesaŋ ntɔgɔ́, ńne ńzíʼi pʉ̀a nò Ssé.
en: He stayed there a year and a half, teaching the word of God among them.

ngiemboon: Á gwɔ́ fʉ̀ʼ ayɛ̌, Ngaliyoŋ gwɔ́ ngúmnɔ̀ɔn na pàga ngwòŋ pà Loma gie mé tóŋo lê Akaye. Pa Yúndà ńnéŋe tà ḿbʉʼʉ nnɛ́ nzèm Pɔ̂ɔ, ńgwoon yé, ńdɔg ńgʉa jʉʼ gie mé sáʼa ntsaŋ wɔ́,
en: While Gallio was proconsul of Achaia, the Jews made a united attack against Paul and brought him to the tribunal.

ngiemboon: ḿbúte yé, ńgɔɔn ngie: «Nyìŋ wɔɔn ne sẅite pʉ̀a ngie pɔ́ guʼte Ssé na ntí gie lepʉ̌ té ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́.»
en: “This man,” they said, “is persuading people to worship God in ways contrary to the law.”

ngiemboon: Pɔ̂ɔ júʼ tà ne faʼa lépÿɛ, Ngaliyoŋ gwóon ńzáʼ, ńgɔɔn mbwó pà Yúndà ngie: «Á kéen péʼe ńgwɔ́ nò lézẅé nyìŋ kà pɔ́ tsɔ̌ máa nò tepòŋ gẅie nyìŋ gÿǒ wɔ́ɔ, mbà n ŋaga nò gí, mbà pà Yúndà.
en: As Paul was about to open his mouth, Gallio said to the Jews, “If it were a matter of wrongdoing or of a serious crime, it would be reasonable for me to put up with you Jews.

ngiemboon: Páʼ pi ké sele pɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, ńzoŋo nò pɔ́ na meshwóŋè, pâ mezíŋ mbɔɔ lepʉ̌ sie é gwɔ́ pɔ́ sí la, á líe pɔ́ gẅí. N te ne ńkwoŋo léŋag yɛ̂ ntí mentsaŋ wɔ́!»
en: But if these are questions about words, names, and your own law, see to it yourselves. I refuse to be a judge of such things.”

ngiemboon: Ngaliyoŋ gɔɔn púʼu, éfó jʉʼ gie mé sáʼa ntsaŋ wó, ńjwoŋo wɔ́b.
en: So he drove them from the tribunal.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ metsèm gwoon Sosetɛne gẅie aa ndÿò tsɛ̀ɛ ndá cúʼtè pɔ́b, ńcúɔ yé jʉʼ gie mé sáʼa ntsaŋ wó, tá Ngaliyoŋ te tsɔ́b.
en: And they all   seized Sosthenes,  # 18:17 1Co 1:1 the leader of the synagogue, and beat him in front of the tribunal, but none of these things mattered to Gallio.

ngiemboon: Pɔ̂ɔ náʼa ńgíŋe ńzye ńnéŋe Koléŋtò. Tá ńdeʼe mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌, ńgʉa Senkelese páʼ à ge kúu lánzì, é gʉa lé Sili pâ Pelésékà pɔ́ Akilásè gwɔ́. Pɔ̂ɔ gwaa kúu kanúʼ, ńzẅága twó yé, ńdɔgɔ ńgɔɔn ngie à gÿǒ mmó gie à la kaʼa mbwó Ssé tà ńcʉ́me.
en: After staying for some time, Paul said farewell to the brothers and sisters and sailed away to Syria, accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila. He shaved his head at Cenchreae because of a vow he had taken.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ gʉa tà ńkúu Efésò, Pɔ̂ɔ nyé Pelésékà pɔ́ Akilásè wó, ńgwaa gʉa, ńzɔɔn ńgʉa ńkúu ndá cúʼtè pà Yúndà, éshwóŋ pà Yúndà nò.
en: When they reached Ephesus   he left them there, but he himself entered the synagogue and debated with the Jews.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zɛ́te yé ngie pâ pɔ̌ náʼa ńzye ńnéŋe. Tá à te zẅíŋ.
en: When they asked him to stay for a longer time, he declined,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, ńgwaa leʼe wɔ́b ńgɔɔn né pɔ́b ngie: «E Ssé lɔɔn ńzẅíŋ, mbà n ge táa tá gíŋe tóo mbʉ̀a pi.» Á gɔɔn pɛ́ʼɛ̀, ńdeen ńké ńgʉa ńkúu kanúʼ, éfó Efésò ńgʉa.
en: but he said farewell and added,   “I’ll come back to you again, if God wills.”  # 18:21 Rm 1:10; 1Co 4:19; 16:7; Heb 6:3; Jms 4:15; 1Pt 3:17 Then he set sail from Ephesus.

ngiemboon: Kanúʼ gÿo ńkúu Sezale Pɔ̂ɔ sẅɛ́ʼ ḿbʉ né Yelúzálèm, ńtsyɛʼte cúʼtè pʉ̀a keleto tá ḿbiŋ, éfó wó ńgʉa lé Aŋtiyokia,
en: On landing at Caesarea, he went up to Jerusalem and greeted the church, then went down to Antioch.

ngiemboon: ńkúu Aŋtiyokia, ńnáʼa ńzye ńnéŋe tá ńgʉa, ńzyɛ́ʼ ye pàga ngwòŋ Ngalasia pɔ́ Filijʉ, ńgiŋe ńkẅiŋte pʉ̀a Keleto.
en: After spending some time there, he set out, traveling through one place after another in the region of Galatia and Phrygia, strengthening all the disciples.

ngiemboon: Atsɔ̌ nyìŋ Yúndà gẅie mé la zyé yé Alezaŋndeli, mé tóŋo yé lê Apolɔ́sè tóo Efésò, ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ ńgɔɔn nò á kẅɛ, ḿbiŋ ńzsé Ŋwàʼne Ssé mboŋó.
en: Now a Jew named Apollos,   a native Alexandrian, an eloquent man who was competent in the use of the Scriptures, arrived in Ephesus.

ngiemboon: Mbà mé ka zíʼi yé páʼ ńgwɔ́ á giŋe na mánzsè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô púʼu. Á ne ńnéŋe twó kwàʼ mboŋó, éshwóŋo yɛ̌ nò, ḿbiŋe ńzíʼi pʉ̀a nò Yěsô pɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ páʼ á gwɔ́. Tá ńgʉa na nò lékẅé ntse, á zsé yé pɔ́ páʼ Jÿâŋ lɔ̌ɔn ńnuʼu pʉ̀a ntse.
en: He had been instructed in the way of the Lord; and being fervent in spirit,   he was speaking and teaching accurately about Jesus, although he knew only John’s baptism.  # 18:25 Lk 7:29; Ac 9:2; 19:3; Rm 12:11

ngiemboon: Á gɔɔn nò Ssé ndá cúʼtè pà Yúndà, pɔ́ shʉashʉa. Pelésékà pɔ́ Akilásè júʼu shwóŋè yé, ńdɔgɔ yé ńgʉa, ńnyɛte ńdaʼte yé nò ńnáa na mánzsè Cʉ̀apʉ̀a.
en: He began to speak boldly in the synagogue. After Priscilla and Aquila heard him, they took him aside   and explained the way of God to him more accurately.  # 18:26 Mt 2:8; Lk 1:3; Ac 18:25; 23:15,20; 24:22; Eph 5:15; 1Th 5:2

ngiemboon: Apolɔ́sè gÿo ne ńtsɔ́ɔn léfó Efésò ńgʉa na pàga ngwòŋ Akaye, mefɛ̌ mefɛ̌ júʼ ńkẅiŋte yé, ńŋweʼe ŋwàʼne, ńnáa mbwó yé, légwɔ́ gie à ge kúu wó, é náa mbwó pazáb ntʉ́m na Keleto pie ée jʉʼó, pɔ́ kúe yé mboŋó. Á gʉa tà ńkúu wó, ḿbú ńkẅéte pʉ̀a Keleto páʼɔɔn tɛʼ, mélàʼmie Ssé la ne ńtóonte yé,
en: When he wanted to cross over to Achaia, the brothers and sisters wrote to the disciples to welcome him. After he arrived, he was a great help to those who by grace had believed.

ngiemboon: pâ pà Yúndà zɔɔn ńtyé mvfò láʼ, ńzoŋo nò ńnáa na Yěsô, á ne ńdɔgɔ nò gie á fóo tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ńnyɛte ńdaʼte ngie Yěsô zɔɔ Nzàʼnkÿo, ḿbú ne ńdɔgɔ yé shwóŋè ńjÿɔ́ʼɔ ncwò pà Yúndà.
en: For he vigorously refuted the Jews in public, demonstrating through the Scriptures that Jesus is the Messiah.
